body:
The b2 backend does have logic to increase the part size if necessary 

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/4d38424e6cbb32d07c74d3b4d760af7afb35742d/backend/b2/upload.go#L101

However that only works if it knows the size of what it is uploading.

If you are using rclone mount with --vfs-cache-mode off , for example, then rclone doesn't know how big the file is.

How are you uploading the file?

It was three weeks ago, i'm not sure the settings i've used.

I do know that i got it resolved with s3 upload parts and server side merge. But that was about 2.5 weeks ago

Coming back to this. I'm not setting the size of the file chunks. The source is sftp, the destination is backblaze


![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1e5acae2-6464-4e76-bbca-539039fa8229)


And here is the source code:

```python
import _thread
import argparse
import threading
from dataclasses import dataclass
from enum import Enum
from queue import Queue
from threading import Thread
from typing import Generator

from rclone_api import (
    CompletedProcess,
    DiffItem,
    DiffOption,
    DiffType,
    Dir,
    Rclone,
    SizeResult,
    rclone_verbose,
)

from mike_tx.rclone_conf import RcloneMap, write_rclone_full

rclone_verbose(True)

_MAX_WORKERS: int | None = None
_LARGE_FILE_THRESHOLD = 1_000_000_000
_LARGE_FILE_BATCH = 2
_SMALL_FILE_BATCH = 10000


class SizeType(Enum):
    LARGE = 1
    SMALL = 2


@dataclass
class Args:
    libsuffixes: list[str]


@dataclass
class Context:
    libname: str
    src_path: str
    dst_path: str
    rclone: Rclone


def _get_server_count(libname: str) -> int:
    rclone_map = RcloneMap()
    servers: list[str] = rclone_map.libname_to_servers(libname)
    assert servers, f"No servers found for {libname}"
    return len(servers)


def _get_context(libname: str, which: int, suffix_path: str) -> Context:
    rclone_map = RcloneMap()
    servers: list[str] = rclone_map.libname_to_servers(libname)
    assert servers, f"No servers found for {libname}"
    rclone = Rclone(write_rclone_full())
    src = servers[which] + f":{libname}"
    dst = f"dst:TorrentBooks/{libname}"
    if suffix_path:
        src += f"/{suffix_path}"
        dst += f"/{suffix_path}"
    return Context(libname, src, dst, rclone)


# SKIP_COUNT = 100000


def scan_missing_folders(context: Context) -> None:
    rclone = context.rclone
    src = context.src_path
    dst = context.dst_path
    dir: Dir
    for dir in rclone.scan_missing_folders(src, dst):
        print(dir)


def compare_files(context: Context) -> Generator[DiffItem, None, None]:
    # rclone = _get_rclone(libname)
    rclone = context.rclone
    item: DiffItem
    src = context.src_path
    dst = context.dst_path
    count = 0
    for item in rclone.diff(
        src,
        dst,
        diff_option=DiffOption.COMBINED,
        size_only=True,
        fast_list=True,
    ):
        count += 1
        yield item

    print(f"Done comparing {count} files.")


def _parse_libname_suffix(libname_suffix: str) -> tuple[str, str]:
    parts = libname_suffix.split("/", 1)
    libname = parts[0]
    if len(parts) > 1:
        suffix_path = parts[1]
    else:
        suffix_path = ""
    return libname, suffix_path


def stream_and_partition_to_worker_queues(
    libname_suffix: str, queue_filelist: Queue[str | None]
) -> None:
    libname, suffix_path = _parse_libname_suffix(libname_suffix)
    context: Context = _get_context(libname, 0, suffix_path=suffix_path)
    try:
        for item in compare_files(context):
            if item is None:
                break
            if item.type == DiffType.MISSING_ON_DST:
                path = item.path
                queue_filelist.put(path)
    except Exception:
        _thread.interrupt_main()
        raise

    finally:
        for _ in range(100):
            queue_filelist.put(None)


def copy_files(
    rclone: Rclone, src: str, dst: str, include_files: list[str], size_type: SizeType
) -> None:
    msg = "\n####################################################"
    msg += f"\n# Copying {len(include_files)} files"
    msg += "\n####################################################\n"
    print(msg)

    multi_thread_streams: int | None = None
    transferes = 64
    low_level_retries = 100
    b2_upload_concurrency = 64
    max_partition_workers = 1
    other_args = [
        "--b2-upload-concurrency",
        str(b2_upload_concurrency),
        "--fix-case",
        "--no-traverse",
    ]

    if size_type == SizeType.LARGE:
        transferes = _LARGE_FILE_BATCH
        low_level_retries = 1000000
        b2_upload_concurrency = 4
        multi_thread_streams = 32
        max_partition_workers = 3
        other_args += ["--multi-thread-cutoff", "50M", "--b2-upload-cutoff", "50M"]
    else:
        other_args += [
            "--multi-thread-cutoff",
            "10000G",
            "--b2-upload-cutoff",
            "10000G",
        ]

    procs: list[CompletedProcess] = rclone.copy_files(
        src=src,
        dst=dst,
        files=include_files,
        max_partition_workers=max_partition_workers,
        check=False,
        transfers=transferes,
        multi_thread_streams=multi_thread_streams,
        low_level_retries=low_level_retries,
        other_args=other_args,
    )
    some_failed = False
    for i, proc in enumerate(procs):
        if not proc.ok:
            some_failed = True
            print(f"Worker failed {i}: {proc}")

    if not some_failed:
        print(f"All {len(procs)} downloads batches succeeded without error.")


def _parse_lib_suffixpath(lib_suffixpath: str) -> tuple[str, str]:
    parts = lib_suffixpath.split("/", 1)
    lib = parts[0]
    if len(parts) > 1:
        suffix_path = parts[1]
    else:
        suffix_path = ""
    return lib, suffix_path


def _partition_files(
    rclone: Rclone, src: str, files: list[str]
) -> tuple[list[str], list[str]]:
    files_large: list[str] = []
    files_small: list[str] = []
    result: SizeResult | Exception = rclone.size_files(src=src, files=files)
    if isinstance(result, Exception):
        raise result
    for path, size in result.file_sizes.items():
        if size > _LARGE_FILE_THRESHOLD:
            files_large.append(path)
        else:
            files_small.append(path)
    return (
        files_small,
        files_large,
    )


class CopyThread(Thread):
    # def __init__(self, context: Context, which: int) -> None:
    def __init__(
        self,
        lib: str,
        which: int,
        out_small_queue: Queue[str | None],
        out_large_queue: Queue[str | None],
    ) -> None:
        super().__init__(daemon=True)
        # self.context = context
        lib, suffix_path = _parse_lib_suffixpath(lib)
        self.context = _get_context(libname=lib, which=which, suffix_path=suffix_path)
        self.out_small_queue = out_small_queue
        self.out_large_queue = out_large_queue
        self.files_large: list[str] = []
        self.files_small: list[str] = []
        self._cancel = threading.Event()
        self.start()

    def _read_next_small_batch(self) -> tuple[bool, list[str]]:
        """Returns drained, current_batch"""
        current_batch: list[str] = []
        while not self.out_small_queue.empty():
            item: str | None = self.out_small_queue.get()
            if item is None:
                self.out_small_queue.put(None)
                return True, current_batch
            current_batch.append(item)
            if len(current_batch) >= _SMALL_FILE_BATCH:
                break
        return False, current_batch

    def _read_next_large_batch(self) -> tuple[bool, list[str]]:
        """Returns drained, current_batch"""
        current_batch: list[str] = []
        while not self.out_large_queue.empty():
            item: str | None = self.out_large_queue.get()
            if item is None:
                self.out_large_queue.put(None)
                return True, current_batch
            current_batch.append(item)
            if len(current_batch) >= _LARGE_FILE_BATCH:
                break
        return False, current_batch

    def run(self) -> None:
        small_que_drained = False
        large_que_drained = False
        try:
            while self._cancel.wait(1) is False:
                if not small_que_drained:
                    small_que_drained, small_batch = self._read_next_small_batch()
                    if small_batch:
                        rclone = self.context.rclone
                        src = self.context.src_path
                        dst = self.context.dst_path
                        copy_files(
                            rclone=rclone,
                            src=src,
                            dst=dst,
                            include_files=small_batch,
                            size_type=SizeType.SMALL,
                        )
                if not large_que_drained:
                    large_que_drained, large_batch = self._read_next_large_batch()
                    if large_batch:
                        rclone = self.context.rclone
                        src = self.context.src_path
                        dst = self.context.dst_path
                        copy_files(
                            rclone=rclone,
                            src=src,
                            dst=dst,
                            include_files=large_batch,
                            size_type=SizeType.LARGE,
                        )
                drained = small_que_drained and large_que_drained
                if drained:
                    break
        except Exception:
            _thread.interrupt_main()
            raise

    def cancel(self) -> None:
        self._cancel.set()


class PartitionThread(Thread):
    """Takes a queue of files and partitions them into two queues based on size"""

    def __init__(
        self,
        libname_suffix: str,
        in_queue: Queue[str | None],
        out_queue_small: Queue[str | None],
        out_queue_large: Queue[str | None],
    ) -> None:
        super().__init__(daemon=True)
        libname, suffix_path = _parse_libname_suffix(libname_suffix)
        self.context = _get_context(libname, 0, suffix_path)
        self.in_queue = in_queue
        self.queue_large = out_queue_large
        self.queue_small = out_queue_small
        self._cancel = threading.Event()
        self.done = threading.Event()
        self.start()

    def _read_next_batch(self) -> tuple[bool, list[str]]:
        """Returns drained, current_batch"""
        current_batch: list[str] = []
        while not self.in_queue.empty():
            # delete_files(self.context, [self.delete_files.get()])
            item: str | None = self.in_queue.get()
            if item is None:
                return True, current_batch
            current_batch.append(item)
        return False, current_batch

    def run(self) -> None:
        rclone = self.context.rclone
        src = self.context.src_path
        try:
            while self._cancel.wait(1) is False:
                drained, current_batch = self._read_next_batch()
                if current_batch:
                    small: list[str] = []
                    large: list[str] = []
                    small, large = _partition_files(
                        rclone=rclone,
                        src=src,
                        files=current_batch,
                    )
                    for item in small:
                        self.queue_small.put(item)
                    for item in large:
                        self.queue_large.put(item)
                if drained:
                    break
        except Exception:
            _thread.interrupt_main()
            raise
        finally:
            self.done.set()
            for _ in range(100):  # why do we need this? TODO come back here.
                self.queue_small.put(None)
                self.queue_large.put(None)


def run(libname: str, n_workers: int) -> None:
    in_queue: Queue[str | None] = Queue()
    out_queue_small: Queue[str | None] = Queue()
    out_queue_large: Queue[str | None] = Queue()

    threads: list[Thread] = [
        PartitionThread(
            libname_suffix=libname,
            in_queue=in_queue,
            out_queue_small=out_queue_small,
            out_queue_large=out_queue_large,
        )
    ]
    threads += [
        # CopyThread(context, which=i) for i in range(n_workers)
        CopyThread(
            lib=libname,
            which=i,
            out_small_queue=out_queue_small,
            out_large_queue=out_queue_large,
        )
        for i in range(n_workers)
    ]
    stream_and_partition_to_worker_queues(
        libname_suffix=libname, queue_filelist=in_queue
    )
    for i, thread in enumerate(threads):
        print(f"Waiting for thread {i} / {n_workers-1}")
        thread.join()


def parse_args() -> Args:
    # lib arg
    rclone_map = RcloneMap()
    libnames: list[str] = rclone_map.get_libnames()
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser()
    libhelp_msg = ",".join(libnames)
    parser.add_argument(
        "libs",
        help=f"Library to diff (you can include a path too), options are {libhelp_msg}",
        nargs="?",
    )
    args = parser.parse_args()
    libs_str: str = args.libs if args.libs else "meta"
    libs = libs_str.split(",")
    return Args(libsuffixes=libs)


def main() -> None:
    # libs: list[str] = [
    #     "meta",
    #     "zlib2",
    #     "zlib2-data",
    #     "zlib3_files",
    #     "aa_derived_mirror_metadata",
    #     "aa_misc_data",
    #     "zlib1",
    #     "ia2_acsmpdf_files",
    #     "libgenrs_nonfiction",
    #     "scimag",
    # ]

    args: Args = parse_args()
    libsuffixes: list[str] = args.libsuffixes

    for libsuffix in libsuffixes:
        lib, _ = _parse_lib_suffixpath(libsuffix)
        n_workers = _get_server_count(lib)
        if _MAX_WORKERS is not None:
            n_workers = min(n_workers, _MAX_WORKERS)
        # n_workers = 1
        print(f"\n################### Copy2 {lib} ##################")
        run(libsuffix, n_workers)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```

User error.

~Another bug, looks like `--multi-thread-chunk-size` is not being respected for the backblaze backend. Next I'll try the `--b2-chunk-size` setting to try and force it for the b2 backend.~

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d6ad0c95-fbb1-4f5b-94db-7f81a133e29a)

Hi @zackees ,
The problem here is that b2 is limited to 10000 parts and so as you noticed it calculates the minimum chunk size. However there was a bug and this value is never used in b2, explaining the defaulting to 96M. This also happens to limit the maximum file size you can send to 96M*10000, which is below your file size.

I will send a pull request to fix this now!

issue.title: b2: fix 1TB+ uploads

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Before this change the minimum chunk size would default to 96M which would allow a maximum size of just below 1TB file to be uploaded, due to the 10000 part rule for b2.

Now the calculated chunk size is used so the chunk size can be 5GB making a max file size of 50TB.

Fixes #8460

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [ ] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [ ] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
Thanks for the fix @roucc 

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.72 and in v1.71.1 if we end up making that.
